qas.question: Which sultan distrusted his admirals during the Russo-Turkish war?
Who was the reformist that had the backing of Ottoman admirals during the Russo-Turkish war?
Where was the Ottoman fleet left to decay?
When was the Young Turk Revolution?
What Ottoman group wanted to form a stronger navy in the early 20th century?

answers.text: the Committee of Union and Progress

context: However, the collapsing Ottoman economy could not sustain the fleet's strength for too long. <a0_0>Sultan Abdülhamid II<a0_0/> distrusted the admirals who sided with the reformist <a1_0>Midhat Pasha<a1_0/>, and claimed that the large and expensive fleet was of no use against the Russians during the Russo-Turkish War. He locked most of the fleet inside <a2_0>the Golden Horn<a2_0/>, where the ships decayed for the next 30 years. Following the Young Turk Revolution in <a3_0>1908<a3_0/>, <a4_0>the Committee of Union and Progress<a4_0/> sought to develop a strong Ottoman naval force. The Ottoman Navy Foundation was established in 1910 to buy new ships through public donations.
